question: Which organization established "Felix Houphouet-Boigny Peace Prize"?
option3: United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation
answer: United Nations Educational Scientific and Cultural Organisation
explanation: United Nations Educational and Scientific Organisation (UNESCO) established the Felix Houphouet-Boigny Peace Prize in 1989. Felix Houphouet-Boigny, the "Sage of Africa", the Father of Cote d'Ivoire Independence, was the President of Cote d'Ivoire from 1960 to 1993. Nelson Mandela and Frederik W. De Klerk were the first laureates of the prize. The 2019 laureate was Abiy Ahmed Ali, the Prime Minister of Ethiopia.
